Design, Body Build, and Display

OPPO A17k measures 164.2 x 75.6 x 8.3 mm and weighs 189g. The device’s body is made of plastic at the back, a plastic body frame, and a glass front. The 6.56-inch IPS display of the Oppo handset has a refresh rate of 60Hz and a resolution of 720 x 1612 pixels, 20:9 ratio (~269 PPI density). It is an average resolution for both work and plays on your device.

Performance and Battery

The handset has a 5,000mAh removable Li-PO battery powering it. It supports up to a 4G network and is ideal for calls, texts, and playing games pre-installed on the device. Enjoy FM Radio on the device as you commute or work and connect to other devices via Bluetooth and WiFi. A 3.5mm jack will enable you to access your FM Radio and media entertainment on the Oppo A17k hands-free.

Installed on the device is a MediaTek MT6765 Helio G35 (12 nm). Running applications and commands in the background is a decent Octa-core (4×2.3 GHz Cortex-A53 & 4×1.8 GHz Cortex-A53) CPU and PowerVR GE8320 GPU. To ensure you do not run out of space and your device operates optimally, Oppo installed 64GB 3GB RAM internal memory on their A17k handset, using eMMC 5.1 technology to maximize space.

Camera

Oppo A17k is a downgraded version of the Oppo A17. The front camera features a single, 5 MP, f/2.2 (wide) camera for selfies and video chats. The front camera’s power is glaringly low, even though it can capture [email protected]

At the back, capture moments and life experiences using a massive single, 8 MP, f/2.0, (wide), AF. With capabilities of [email protected], you will be able to capture moments in still and motion, but a lot is left to be desired. Supported by LED flash and panorama, the 8MP lens needs to catch up to the best standards in the modern-day mobile world of cameras.

Connectivity and Sensors

Oppo A17 is a 4G-network-enabled device. Enjoy fast upload and download speeds, depending on the signal strength of your network provider. For convenience, Oppo installed several sensors on its handset: Fingerprint (side-mounted), accelerometer, Proximity, and Compass

Pros and Cons of the Oppo A17k

Pros

  • A budget phone that performs decently well for its price
  • Large battery capacity
  • Large display at 6.56 inches.
  • Comes with Panda glass protection.
  • The latest android OS installed
  • Supports ColorOS for customization
  • Side-mounted fingerprint sensor
  • IPX4 water resistance coating.
  • Dedicated micro SD card slot.
  • Side-mounted fingerprint scanner.

Cons

  • Low RAM and internal storage
  • Low display resolution
  • Below average camera setup.
  • No Gyro-EIS support for video recording.
  • No fast or reverse charging support.

Verdict

The Oppo A17k is a great budget, entry device at Kes 15,500. However, the camera is really a downside on an otherwise decent handset that will get you browsing, chatting, and communicating with people effortlessly.

FAQs

  • What material is used on Oppo A17k? IPS LPS Display front, plastic frame, plastic back
  • What are the dimensions of the Oppo A17k? 2 x 75.6 x 8.3 mm

  • Is the Oppo A17k water and dustproof? It comes with IPX4 Water resistance certification.
  • Does the Oppo A17k display come with a protector? Yes. Panda Glass protection.
  • What is the internal memory capacity of the Oppo A17k? 64GB 3GB RAM.
  • Does the Oppo A17k support fast charging? It has USB 2.0 port that supports fast charging but does not come with a fast-charging adapter.
  • What colors are available for Oppo A17k? Navy Blue and Gold.
  • Is the Oppo A17k good for gaming? For basic, low, and mid-setting video games.

Design and Build

Xiaomi 12S Ultra is a beautifully designed premium smartphone. The 6.73-inch panel offers a resolution of 3200 x 1440 pixels and thus achieves a crisp 522 ppi. The Dolby Vision TrueColor display offers a native 10-bit color depth and can naturally cover 100% of the DCI-P3 color space. The screen supports HDR 10 as well as HDR10+ and HLG. The maximum brightness is a brilliant 1500 nits, so even direct sunlight is no problem in terms of the legibility of digital content.

The LTPO 2.0 panel supports variable refresh rates from 1 to 120 Hz. The 5G-enabled device consists of an eco-leather back, and aluminum frame. At the front, a Corning Gorilla Glass protects the AMOLED display. The fingerprint sensor is conveniently placed under the display. It comes in Black and Dark Green color variants, giving users two solid options to pick from for the best experiences.

Performance

The Xiaomi 12S Ultra is one of the fastest devices on the market. This is made possible by the new Snapdragon 8 Plus Gen 1 from Qualcomm. The once again improved CPU clocks with up to 3.2 GHz and is accompanied by a powerful Adreno GPU. A full 12 GB of LPDDR5 RAM supports the processor in everyday use and ensures that even the most demanding apps and games cannot exhaust the smartphone’s performance. Xiaomi also relies on quality for internal storage. The UFS 3.1 ROM is not only generous with 512 GB, but also very fast. A double SIM Card 5G connectivity is a big plus for the premium device, guaranteeing fast connectivity and accessing data on the phone.

Camera

Xiaomi leaves no doubt: The camera throne is the intended goal and the new gigantic Sony IMX989 sensor is the weapon to conquer it. As the first smartphone ever, the Xiaomi 12S Ultra can boast of a 1-inch 50-megapixel sensor, which in combination with the f/1.9 aperture ensures superior photo shots – even in low-light conditions. Ultra-wide-angle shots are also taken at absolutely high-resolution thanks to the 48-megapixel Sony IMX586 sensor with f/2.2 aperture and Leica Summicron support. The telephoto lens is equally high quality, equipped with a 48-megapixel Sony IMX586 sensor with f/4.1 aperture. Thanks to Hyper OIS, superior image stabilization is utilized, allowing for smooth shooting even at zoom. Due to the 120x zoom, this is also much needed.

Battery

Thanks to the large built-in battery, even particularly long days without stopping at the charging cable are no problem. The internal power source is very generous with 4860 mAh and promises outstanding battery runtimes, not least thanks to the adaptive refresh rate and energy-saving OLED technology. The battery can be recharged via USB C cable with up to 67W. The battery does not fill up significantly slower via Wireless Charge thanks to 50W support. Reverse charging with up to 10W is also possible. The specially developed Xiaomi Surge P1 chip ensures intelligent charging and battery management. Both the battery runtime and the lifespan of the internal power sources benefit significantly from the new chip.
